meta_data: {'manufacturer': 'NITECORE', 'part number': 'MH25GT+USB', 'product dimensions': '16 x 2.54 x 3.99 cm; 198.45 Grams', 'batteries': '1 Lithium ion batteries required.', 'item model number': 'MH25GT', 'is discontinued by manufacturer': 'No', 'size': 'Medium', 'colour': 'Black', 'material': 'Aluminum alloy', 'power source': 'Battery-powered', 'item package quantity': '1', 'type of bulb': 'Led', 'brightness': '1000', 'performance description': '1000 Lumens', 'cutting diameter': '1 Inches', 'certification': 'ANSI-Rated', 'included components': 'Batteries', 'batteries included?': 'No', 'batteries required?': 'No', 'battery cell type': 'Lithium Ion', 'battery description': '2x CR123A or 18650', 'assembled diameter': '1 Inches', 'item weight': '198 g'}

reviews: I read the reviews over and over and watched videos of the light. Pew Pew tactical had this as their #1 light for this category. It looked to good to be true and in fact was. I have used mostly high quality lights in the past in a professional and personal fashion. Streamlight and Surefire. The light came and I went through it. It feels well made and is a bit big and hard to carry on the belt. that said it fits my hand nicely. The disappointment came when I turned it on. I thought the battery must have been low on charge and that was why i wasn't impressed with the brightness. I charged it up for the full 6 hours and then got back out at night. Its not that it isnt bright but all the reviews about the 1000 lumens lighting up everything just wasnt there. I had it toggled for max then down to a long lasting 50 lumens. I grabbed my family and my Surefire G2 and went out back and compared the two. Every family member said they couldnt see a difference in the two beams or brightness. The MH25 GT is a $100 dollar light and my G2 was $59 bucks 3 years ago and I see zero difference. Not impressed.
product_name: Nitecore MH25 2014 Edition 960 Lumens 340 Yards Long Throw Rechargeable Cree XM-L2 U2 LED Flashlight w/ Built-in USB Charger, 2300mAh 18650 Rechargeable Battery, USB Cable, LumenTac AC & Car Power Adapter, Holster

reviews: Iv'e been using Nitecore battery chargers for years because they make quality products. When I became aware of their Nitecore MH25GT tactical light I purchased it right away for my bedroom night stand. Warning-This tactical light is extremely bright on the high beam, works very well and longer battery life on lower beam setting. High-low and strobe options, with a built in charger for 18650 batteries. This is another Nitecore quality product that I would buy again.
product_name: Nitecore MH25 2014 Edition 960 Lumens 340 Yards Long Throw Rechargeable Cree XM-L2 U2 LED Flashlight w/ Built-in USB Charger, 2300mAh 18650 Rechargeable Battery, USB Cable, LumenTac AC & Car Power Adapter, Holster

reviews:
Great light, very bright, multiple carry options, includes tactical ring. Does emit advertised luminosity. Nitecore has been my go-to duty light for as long as I can remember.

Only two cons in my opinion, but they were fixed on the newer model

1) non-reversible clip, orientation is always head-up
2) rotating housing for selector modes

In an intense situation, changing from beam to strobe can be difficult with this light if you do not practice with it. New model has a selector switch instead of a rotating body.
product_name: Nitecore MH25 2014 Edition 960 Lumens 340 Yards Long Throw Rechargeable Cree XM-L2 U2 LED Flashlight w/ Built-in USB Charger, 2300mAh 18650 Rechargeable Battery, USB Cable, LumenTac AC & Car Power Adapter, Holster

reviews:
I've had different small frame flashlights. The reason I like this one the best...it's Nitecore...best I've used.

Some small ones are the same diameter, and won't stand up without falling over. The lens end is larger, and will stand upside down easily.

Easy to charge with any STD micro USB charger...no more 123A batteries. Plenty of brightness levels (including SOS and strobe). It doesn't get excessively hot after long periods of use.

The focus isn't adjustable, but that's never been an issue.

I cannot explain more, but I just like the fit and finish of this light. Every joint is protected by rubber grommets.
product_name: Nitecore MH25 2014 Edition 960 Lumens 340 Yards Long Throw Rechargeable Cree XM-L2 U2 LED Flashlight w/ Built-in USB Charger, 2300mAh 18650 Rechargeable Battery, USB Cable, LumenTac AC & Car Power Adapter, Holster

reviews: This light has several things I was wanting, one it can be recharged from a mini USB (read, I can charge it in the truck). second, durable, it appears to be well built, three, bright, definitely very bright. Problem is I cannot for the life of me figure out how to work it. I can get the light to come on, but I can't get it to cycle to lower settings, it's pretty much "surface of the sun" or off. and when it's on it sometimes flutters on and off until you mess with it. I don't know if it's broken, or has the worse switch design in the history of flashlights.
product_name: Nitecore MH25 2014 Edition 960 Lumens 340 Yards Long Throw Rechargeable Cree XM-L2 U2 LED Flashlight w/ Built-in USB Charger, 2300mAh 18650 Rechargeable Battery, USB Cable, LumenTac AC & Car Power Adapter, Holster

reviews: I have been using this light for a couple weeks now and WOW! I have a couple of well known similar TAC lights that used 4 AAA batteries and were rated at 175 and 325 lumens. We live in the woods with about an acre of cleared ground and when we take our dog out 3 or 4X each night we use these lights to keep an eye out for predators. We end up replacing the batteries every week or so when the light goes dim on those lights. With the Nitecore MH25GT I have been using the light for 10 days now on high and every once in a while I even move it up to "turbo" and it is still putting out way more light than the other two did! Just on high it is easily 2 to 3 times brighter than the other lights and on turbo....wow. When it does start to lose power, I'll just plug it in for the night and the next day it is ready to go again! One thing to be aware of is that it does not have an adjustable beam. However the outer ring of light is huge and the center beam is high intensity and the throw is really long. I can easily scan the tree line and see back into the woods from 250 feet. This is a well made and professional quality tool.
product_name: Nitecore MH25 2014 Edition 960 Lumens 340 Yards Long Throw Rechargeable Cree XM-L2 U2 LED Flashlight w/ Built-in USB Charger, 2300mAh 18650 Rechargeable Battery, USB Cable, LumenTac AC & Car Power Adapter, Holster

reviews:
Works great even after months of hard work!

You can easily select between the modes or overdrive by twisting the light. I'm only giving 4 stars for this flashlight because it's tedious to select between the modes you want.
I used this flashlight to: search, find footprints, conduct inspections, and blind coworkers. lol
It's about 1/10 as bright as the sun to give you an idea of how bright this flashlight can get.
For its cost, power, and quality, it earned a spot on my utility belt.

review_title: Great light and doesn't break the bank.
reviews: This thing is fantastic, although i wish it had a dedicated strobe button. With that said the construction, durability is amazing. Everything is sealed with oil and O-rings making it water proof and although it may be small it packs a big punch. At night on high setting it will light up a farther distance than the eye can see. Also, its evenly weighted fitting comfortably in your hands. Battery life has not been an issue yet for me although i do not use it excessively. If i were to use this everyday i would consider purchasing an extra battery with a dedicated charger.
product_name: Nitecore MH25 2014 Edition 960 Lumens 340 Yards Long Throw Rechargeable Cree XM-L2 U2 LED Flashlight w/ Built-in USB Charger, 2300mAh 18650 Rechargeable Battery, USB Cable, LumenTac AC & Car Power Adapter, Holster

reviews:
This has replaced all other flashlights in my work truck. Right size to Lumen output ratio and it can charge right next to my android phone (sorry Iphony users). It has held up to many long drops of 10' plus onto concrete and shows no signs of slowing down.
-Selection of low, medium, strobe is a bit cumbersome though not prohibitively. I rarely use less than full brightness anyway.
-Belt clip pops off of the unit and falls into your pocket while your flashlight goes bouncing down the stairs if you're not careful. This could use a better design of connection than compression. To compensate, there were two clips in the box, so they're obviously aware of this issue.
-The wrist lanyard wore out and gave up after about 6 months of storing in my pocket (due to no belt clips). In reality I don't need this feature, but it could have been a bit more robust of a strap.
-Takes a full night 8+hours to charge half the battery no matter what input milliamp cord you plug into it. Its an internal issue of charge rate, not the cord or supply you use in this case.
product_name: Nitecore MH25 2014 Edition 960 Lumens 340 Yards Long Throw Rechargeable Cree XM-L2 U2 LED Flashlight w/ Built-in USB Charger, 2300mAh 18650 Rechargeable Battery, USB Cable, LumenTac AC & Car Power Adapter, Holster

review_title: Top Shelf Lighting Product - Quality Made
reviews:
Being one of many nowadays who are classified as "flashlight geeks" because we are interested in high-end hand-held lighting products - I too just added this unit to my collection of flashlights (yeah as if I really needed another flashlight), right?

Bottom lines for the potential purchaser: This Model light is of very high quality of manufacture. Meaning that the machining is quality (no flashings of metal, or poor tool bit cutting), the anodizing finish is excellent throughout, the REFLECTOR itself is perfectly paraboticly shaped, finished without any milkyness or bumps in the surfaces. The LENS is crystal clear, and is supposed to be hard enough to help prevent scratches. The included HOSTER fits well and is better made than some of the other offers commonly out there. The RECHARGING port (USB type) is covered by the sliding metal sleeve which wraps around the flashlights mid-section, moving up/down after being unlocked via its internal screw threading to close/open this sleeve - which incorporates a tightly fitting "O" ring to prevent dust/water etc. from entering the charging port (two extra rings are also included in this package interchangeable for the Tail Cap, and Sleeve if ever needed). The light casts an even circle throughout its distance. You chose the "Super" lighting mode by rotating the lights head all the way down. By loosening the head slightly away from full close now enables the other functions of multiple lower intensities, strobe, etc. Is this light truly 960 or 860 Lumens (as printed with both these specs in the manual), a misprint or not?

In comparing the output of this light's advertised brilliance (960/860) using fully charged 18650 known good and new batteries - I do not have a Lighting strength/Lumen testing analyzer - BUT comparing its output to other similar lights owned, I DO NOT believe this is actually some 960 Lumens of brilliance. That being said however, it DOES provide a very brilliant light. Appears to be about the same as other 500-600 Lumen high end lighting products of good repute. SO - Should you buy this product, YES.., very well made, and this package includes a nice assortment of accessories, and is recommended. Hope this provides additional insight for the perspective buyer.

My only complaint is that I struggle a bit with knowing whether I'm cycling through the select-mode settings or not when I turn it on or off. In general, amazing light.
product_name: Nitecore MH25 2014 Edition 960 Lumens 340 Yards Long Throw Rechargeable Cree XM-L2 U2 LED Flashlight w/ Built-in USB Charger, 2300mAh 18650 Rechargeable Battery, USB Cable, LumenTac AC & Car Power Adapter, Holster

reviews: Now this is a great flashlight! As a retired police officer, I had previously purchased Streamlight Polystinger flashlights. The polystinger is a rechargeable light as well, and similar in size to this one. I received the Nitecore MH25 flashlight today and I have to say that it blows the Streamlight Polystinger away! I charged the Nitecore for a couple of hours until it was fully charged and grabbed my Polystinger from its charging cradle. I went into a dark room and turned both lights on. The Nitecore has a very bright white beam. The Polystinger had a yellowish beam that was much weaker than the Nitecore. I just purchased a new battery for a second Polystinger that I own. I wish I had saved my money and put it towards another one of these awesome lights. I love the idea of having a rechargeable light. I just received it today so I can't review how long the charge lasts, etc. I rarely write reviews but I was so excited about this powerful light I wanted to share my thoughts in case it might help someone else in making a decision on what light to buy. I only wish this light would have been available when I was working. This light really shines! üòÅ

reviews: I've been looking for a solid handheld flashlight for quite some time now and I've finally landed on one that I'm happy with. I've bought a Fenix LD22 and an EagleTac P20C2 Mark II and this light definitely takes the cake. The MH25 is WAY brighter than the other 2 and feels solid in terms of durability and hand manipulation. I recently used it in a night-time shooting course and my instructor asked me if I had a lightsaber. It's that awesome. This package is hard to beat considering it was only about 70 bucks for a well-built rechargeable light with the adapters and the keychain light (yes, even that thing's pretty damn bright considering how big it is). I don't really put up too many reviews but I felt this light deserved it.

review_title: What a tactical light should be.
reviews:
Been in law enforcement for almost 14 years, and been faithfully carrying Surefire LED lights since their infancy. It's unthinkable that this technology has come so far, and that a company like nitecore could turn out a product that out performs and costs less than the industry leader's. A light like this would have sold for a grand ten years ago. It has a nicely focused beam that can reach out and touch a hidden suspect a good 100 yards or more if you need it. You can use it indoors and not destroy your retinas. And the battery that ships with it is a solid rechargeable battery.

I work in a rural environment these days after 13 years in a big city. I will tell you that my old SL20 with upgraded LED bulb has been retired, my Surefires are now going out to pasture, and this guy is my new primary duty light. Probably going to buy a second one and put it on my rifle for some test and evaluation. Might even get a third. It's just that nice of a light.

review_title: On a clear night the beam sends an honest 278 meter "used laser range finder for distance" beam that lights up a tree line like
reviews: Way more flashlight than I expected for the price! All features work as expected. On a clear night the beam sends an honest 278 meter "used laser range finder for distance" beam that lights up a tree line like daylight. Only drawback in my opinion is the lack of a pulse or strobe feature.... No reason to drop a star from a product for not having a feature it isn't supposed to come with. Rating is for the product as is and delivered. If you want more options then get a different light. If you want what is described it CAN NOT be beat!

review_title: Great jack-of-all-trades light. Find myself grabbing this over significantly more expensive lights.
reviews: The MH25GT is a great hybrid light that blends spill and throw quite well. Don't expect this to be the best thrower or the best EDC light, that's not the intent behind this light. This is designed to be a light you leave by the door or in a backpack instead of carrying on your person. This is designed to have a bit of throw while providing plenty of spill illumination too and it does this very, very well. When walking the dog, exploring dark areas, or generally doing anything in the dark that requires more than 10m of illumination but less than 100m, this light is always my first choice. The USB charger and the UI are both fantastic features and add even more value to this light.

product_name: Nitecore MH25 2014 Edition 960 Lumens 340 Yards Long Throw Rechargeable Cree XM-L2 U2 LED Flashlight w/ Built-in USB Charger, 2300mAh 18650 Rechargeable Battery, USB Cable, LumenTac AC & Car Power Adapter, Holster

product_name: Nitecore MH25 2014 Edition 960 Lumens 340 Yards Long Throw Rechargeable Cree XM-L2 U2 LED Flashlight w/ Built-in USB Charger, 2300mAh 18650 Rechargeable Battery, USB Cable, LumenTac AC & Car Power Adapter, Holster

reviews:
This flashlight is bright enough for its size. In fact, with these latest crop of LED lights one should be wary not to damage eyes and/or NV optics. No fooling around with powerful light sources, be warned!
The best part of this flashlight and that whole Hybrid series by Nitecore (other brands also provide similar feature) is easy maintainability on the go - going on a trip or an expedition always requires you to decide which of those things you need you will not take:) Cause if you take that one more item your backpack will burst open or it gonna be that last straw to break your back. So not needing to take one more charger is absolutely great! Same damn USB 5V 2A charger will go for your navigator, phone, tablet/subnote and flashlight too!
The make of MH25 is strong, with its steel lid and anodized 6xxx cast aluminum frame - it can take beating, in fact in emergency situation it can "provide" beating.
The size is about right too. Sure, torches made for AA bats cross section feel much more compact (for example MT22), yet as of 2014 none of them provides comparable amount of light. As for flashlights with cross section for 123 bats but with lesser reflector (like MH2C) - the beam feels a tiny bit worse, while the bulkiness is pretty much the same.
I did consider MH40 "Thor" for it provides twice as much charge, but it did feel too big with its huge lid.
The only thing I dont like in this (and just about any other) torch is how modes are picked by twisting. I hope they will in time meld their S.R.T. series controls with Hybrid series built-in charger... but until then MH25 is perfect for me.
product_name: Nitecore MH25 2014 Edition 960 Lumens 340 Yards Long Throw Rechargeable Cree XM-L2 U2 LED Flashlight w/ Built-in USB Charger, 2300mAh 18650 Rechargeable Battery, USB Cable, LumenTac AC & Car Power Adapter, Holster
